name: Hotel Nefeli

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're like us - young people traveling on a budget - the Hotel Nefeli is a good place to stay in Athens. I spent a lot of time reading reviews before booking here, and most of the problems mentioned by travelers at other Athens budget hotels weren't an issue here.
reviews.title: Decent for a budget hotel, great location, some bad quirks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Nefeli is in a quiet, safe (we never felt uncomfortable walking around the area at night), but nevertheless very central area in the character-filled neighborhood of Plaka, close to the Syntagma metro stop and within walking distance of most of the sights you'll want to see in Athens. The carb-heavy breakfast isn't fantastic, but it's no worse than what you'll find at other Athenian hotels and - importantly - is included in the room rate! We stayed at an off-peak time (January) and the rate was second to none.
reviews.title: Good location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are basic but clean. They have AC. Expect to get two twin beds if you book a double room. The TV is snowy and mostly consists of Greek channels (though we got CNN) and there is no internet access. Aside from peeling paint here and there, everything appears relatively well maintained.
reviews.title: A big relief

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I do "recommend this hotel to a friend," I hesitate to give this hotel a "very good" or higher rating because of certain quirks that some travelers may find intolerable. The beds are very firm, and one of the two beds in our room was very creaky. The shower was small and tended to flood onto the bathroom floor. Room service was fine the first few days, but the attendant failed to replace our towels on the last day; also, she typically left the room with the window wide open (with no screen). The closet setup was bizarre, with drawers that couldn't really be opened, and it was oddly cold compared with the rest of the room (probably only a problem in the winter), resulting in an unpleasantly chilly experience when we first put our clothes on in the morning. Budget travelers have learned to deal with this sort of thing, but those who can afford it may wish to spend more and stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: fantastic location, great value

reviews.text: Note: Google Maps is very inconsistent in Athens and won't help you here. Use the map on their website, hotel-nefeli.com - print it out and hand it to your taxi driver and/or take it with you when you take the metro (line 3, the blue line, goes straight from the airport to Syntagma but stops running at 11:30 at night or so). Also, don't miss the chance to have a brief conversation with Tom across the street.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: This hotel has all the necessities: cleanliness, good value, hot water, air conditioning and it even has a great location in Plaka! If you're looking for all the bells and whistles, this is not the place for you. But if you're planning to use your hotel as a place to sleep and shower and want to be close to the Athens action for a reasonable price, this is definitely where you should stay :) I'd say it's the equivalent of a Super 8 in America. I also want to point out that it's in a safe location for any solo female travelers who are concerned about that. I can't stress enough what a great location it is!
reviews.title: Everything you would need in a great location!

reviews.text: We only needed 1 nights accomodation and arrived at 0830 and even were offered breakfast and the room was ready, plus they quoted 1 price and then made it less expensive! There were three of us, a couple and our 18year old, it was perfect, as we needed somewhere close to the Plaka.
reviews.title: location perfect, small comfortable, friendly- thank you!!

reviews.text: When we closed the wooden sliding shutter at night there was hardly any street noise, amazed! But it made the room pitch black and we all slept in!
reviews.title: My Grecian Home

likes.liked: — location, breakfast and the people who ran it

reviews.title: crazy gang tom pat peter annette
reviews.text: Staff are very friendly, and helpful. Breakfast was a bonus!
I was so pleased to come across such an ideal location and comfortable hotel in that area.
reviews.title: Noisy Nefeli

likes.disliked: — the constant noise and the really bad breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Nefeli is conveniently located close to the Plaka (albeit a bit difficult for some taxi drivers to find). Its best features are location and price, but I wouldn't consider it a "find" by any means. Rooms are small and there is no sound-proofing. Fortunately, it was relatively quiet while we were there, but you could still hear doors close on every floor, not just your own.
reviews.title: Budget budget budget
Perfect in the Plaka
reviews.text: A nice, small hotel in a perfect location away from the chacophony of Athens. In the morning you step outside and wander Plaka long before the shops open or the rest of the tourists descend. The hotel seems more like the hospitable Greece of old, not like a big, glitzy place that feels like any other hotel in any other city in the world. The small staff is always efficient and as friendly or as cool as the clientele. I've stayed there many times and just reserved rooms for another fall visit.

reviews.title: Nefeli Hotel
reviews.text: The Nefeli would be nice if the owners weren't so grumpy. The situation is good apart from the filthy derelict sight across the road with it's plethora of dozens of cats which make the area where the hotel is smell to high heaven. The breakfast is spartan and the woman serving is dour and austere. I disliked the whole experience of being there but it was convenient and less expensive than other over rated Athens hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location near tourist sites. Breakfast is included in room rate: juice, tea, coffee, lots of bread, pound cake, jam and a hard boiled egg per person. They sold bottled water in the lobby.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As our flight into Athens was canceled, we called Nefeli to change our check in date and was grateful when they obliged.
reviews.title: A good location for sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, we were given possibly the worst room in Nefeli. If I remember correctly, it was room 102. There were 3 single beds in there with no TV. One bed had no sheets and looked very dirty and old. The floor had a layer of dust like it hadn't been cleaned for months...My spouse couldn't sleep at night and had difficulty breathing, possibly from dust allergy.
reviews.title: Probably the best location in Athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff weren't very friendly and reluctant to share information. We wanted to watch the world cup in the hotel lobby but the staff told us that the broadcasting crew was on strike so they didn't broadcast world cup that day, and he continued watching news in the lobby. So we went out and found a cafe only a few blocks away with world cup on their local network!
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel is AMAZING location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely our least favorite stay in Greece, thank goodness it was only for 1 night.
reviews.title: A comfortable stay, ideally situated, with helpful staff and excellent rates..

description: Right in the heart of beautiful Athens city (Greece), in the scenic area of Plaka, on the foothills of the magnificent monument of Acropolis, you can find the comfortable "Nefeli" Hotel. Established in 1976, this small (18 room in total) family run hotel, has managed to gain many loyal customers over the years, both from Greece and abroad.Also, Nefeli Hotel has recently been refurbished in the neoclassical style to fit in harmony with its' surroundings. Nefeli Hotel location in Plakanefeli is situated only five minutes on foot from Athens’ city center and yet in a very peaceful area. It is located between the Metro Stations of Syntagma and Acropolis, close to tram and central bus lines. Staying at Nefeli Hotel is very convenient, as you are able to reach the many sights of Athens very easily.
